articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Sure, we could have signed Paulo Bernardo three weeks ago, but to what end?  If you want to know what signing players on the wrong deal feels like, look at the fire sale across the city. Celtic exist as a dominant force in Scottish football because – in general – they sign players of the [...]
articles.title: Sign players of the right profile for the right sum on the right contracts

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC have stepped up their bid to strengthen the left-back position with a second move for Wolves’ Hugo Bueno. Brendan Rodgers failed in an attempt to persuade the Midlands club to release the Spanish Under-21 international in a loan deal at the turn of the year. However, with the Premiership kick-off against Kilmarnock at Parkhead [...]
articles.title: CELTIC IN TRANSFER TUG-OF-WAR

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR is a veteran of marathon campaigns since being handed his Celtic debut by Ronny Deila in July 2014. The Celtic skipper, 31, has clocked up 50 games or more every season over the past seven years on his way to picking up a remarkable 22 trophies. It’s a phenomenal sequence of personal honours – [...]
articles.title: ‘AYE, FOR SURE,’ MARATHON MAN McGREGOR READY FOR NEW CHALLENGES

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TOMMY BURNS’ third year as Celtic manager was developing into a rollicking rollercoaster. The fans’ favourite had returned to the club on July 12 1994 and had won the Scottish Cup in his debut campaign. That was followed by a barren term and all eyes were on the boss as a new challenging and testing [...]
articles.title: THE TOMMY BURNS STORY: PIERRE’S PAY ROW, BOSS SEES RED IN OLD FIRM FLARE-UP: Part Fifteen

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MAGNUS HEDMAN arrived at Celtic after solid performances as Sweden’s goalkeeper in the 2002 World Cup Finals in Japan. Martin O’Neill paid £1.5million to Coventry City for the 29-year-old netminder as he sought competition to Rab Douglas, an earlier purchase from Dundee for £1million. Hedman appeared to be the answer to a problem position, but [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…MAGNUS HEDMAN?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: HENRIK LARSSON became a genuine Celtic legend during his glorious, mesmerising and breathtaking seven years at the club. But his move from Feyenoord to Paradise exactly 27 years ago almost didn’t take place when an eleventh-hour hitch materialised. Today, in a CQN EXCLUSIVE extract from Davie Hay’s autobiography, ‘The Quiet Assassin’, co-authored by Alex Gordon, we reveal [...]
articles.title: THE SNAG THAT ALMOST KO’d HENRIK DEAL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: PAULO BERNARDO has finalised his £3.5million move to Celtic from Benfica after agreeing a five-year deal. The 22-year-old Portuguese playmaker, who impressed during his season-long loan, finally put pen to paper to complete the switch to the champions. And the Hoops are pursuing a loan deal for Wolves left-back Hugo Bueno who was a target [...]
articles.title: BERNARDO SEALS DEAL, BUENO ON WAY?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The job of a backup keeper is unlike any other role.  Unlike outfield players, they can often pick up a wage without ever seeing first team action.  There was recently a keeper at Benfica who had more winners’ medals than appearances to his name. It’s a deal with the devil.  Pick up wages not available [...]
articles.title: The keeper’s deal with the devil

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: HOW much would you pay for a back-up player? I’m talking about a performer who would not be guaranteed a first-team start every week. A solid, reliable sort who can answer the call to duty when required. Celtic’s record purchase remains the £9million they shelled out for Odsonne Edouard from Paris Saint-Germain in June 2018 after [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: THE IDAH QUESTION

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BENJI SIEGRIST has quit Celtic after just two appearances in two years to join Neil Lennon’s Rapid Bucharest. The 32-year-old Swiss keeper dropped to fourth in the pecking order after the arrival of Kasper Schmeichel and Viljami Sinisalo to join Scott Bain in Brendan Rodgers’ first-team squad for the new season. Siegrist, whose two outings [...]
articles.title: CONFIRMED: BENJI BOWS OUT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC will discover their Premier League Cup opponents when the draw is made on Sunday around 5pm. Brendan Rodgers has won the trophy three times in his four attempts over his two stints as Hoops boss. After three successive triumphs – Aberdeen (3-0, 2016), Motherwell (2-0, 2017) and the Dons again (1-0, 2018), the Parkhead [...]
articles.title: CELTIC IN SUNDAY CUP DRAW

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THE third year of Tommy Burns’ managerial career at Celtic was not going according to plan. The fans’ favourite had returned to the club on July 12 1994 and had won the Scottish Cup in his debut campaign. That was followed by a barren term and all eyes were on the boss as a new [...]
articles.title: THE TOMMY BURNS STORY: PROBLEM PILE-UP IN PARADISE: Part Fourteen

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NEIL LENNON snapped up Jonjoe Kenny on a short-term loan deal from Everton in late January 2021. The former England Under-21 international right-back was introduced to the first team immediately and made his debut in a 4-0 win over Kilmarnock at Rugby Park. Kenny’s appearance in Ayrshire was one of only 14 league appearances for [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…JONJOE KENNY?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: When results from preseason friendlies are discussed, I always think back to Sachsen Leipzig.  24 years ago, Martin O’Neill took his new Celtic team to face the fourth-tier German club, fielded a team with Sutton, Larsson, Mjallby, Stubbs, Lambert, Petrov, Moravcik and Boyd, and lost 2-0. Problem was, we also had Rafael and Tebily in [...]
articles.title: Sachsen Redemption

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT WAS Celtic to the four for the second successive outing in their USA tour as they overcame Manchester City 4-3 in North Carolina this morning. Brendan Rodgers watched his side get off to the perfect start on the trip in Washington at the weekend when they strolled to a 4-0 victory over MLS outfit [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THE WINNING mentality of Kasper Schmeichel was highlighted in the Danish legend’s Celtic debut in North Carolina this morning. The 37-year-old 105 times-capped keeper made his Hoops baptism as he played the first-half of the 4-3 victory over Manchester City. Schmeichel was replaced at the interval by Finnish international Viljami Sinisalo who arrived in a [...]
articles.title: ANGUISH OF ‘PERFECTIONIST’ SCHMEICHEL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: AMERICA proved to the the perfect launch pad for Celtic’s spectacular 1966/67 season when Jock Stein’s all-conquering heroes achieved unparalled success. Billy McNeill and Co were unstoppable as they blitzed the opposition home and abroad to win EVERY tournament in which they competed. The domestic treble was won in swashbuckling style before Big Jock’s juggernaut brought [...]

articles.description: KYOGO FURUASHI was back in the goal routine when he claimed a trademark strike in Celtic’s 4-3 win over Manchester City in North Carolina this morning. The Japanese striker stuttered a bit last season when he completed the campaign with only 19 goals after a haul of 34 the previous term. However, the fleet-footed forward [...]
articles.title: CRACKSHOT KYOGO STRIKES AGAIN

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TOMMY BURNS was preparing for his third year in charge of Celtic since returning as manager on July 12 1994. articles.description: NICOLAS KUHN fired in a double as Celtic overcame Manchester City 4-3 in thriller in North Carolina this morning. The German winger struck twice in the first-half before Kyogo Furuhashi tucked away an excellent third just before the interval to give the Hoops a 3-1 half-time advantage. Pep Guardiola’s side pulled it back to 3-3 in [...]
articles.title: KUHN AT THE DOUBLE AS CELTIC WIN 7-GOAL THRILLER

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LUKASZ ZALUSKA arrived at Celtic in the summer of 2009 after the Polish keeper signed a pre-contract contract in January as his Dundee United deal ticked down. articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…LUKASZ ZALUSKA?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: With four years left on Matt O’Riley’s contract, Celtic can afford to reject any offer which falls below their valuation.  Atalanta’s reported bid of around £14.5m was not expected to be accepted.  The Italian club know that Celtic can afford to wait until late in the window in the hope of attracting others to the [...]

articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS and Kasper Schmeichel look like a marriage made in soccer heaven. The Irishman and the Dane combined to lift the English FA Cup for the Midlands club in 2021 and [...]

Schmeichel arrived just hours before the champions’ first game of their [...]
